body.p:
Bowling Green Ky
July 15 1863
To
Gov J F Robinson:
Dear Sir: We wish to call yr attention to the Regiment which Col Jno W Green is authorised to recruit in this Section --

There are guerilla bands all through our County stealing horses: -- indeed, that seems to be their business. In a month or two more they will steal enough to mount a Regiment or nearly So -- unless checked in this course -- Now, we have the Stock in this Country -- and if the Government will purchase we can procure horses enough to mount this Regiment -- If we do not, an equal number will in all probability be lost to this by the thefts of these bands of plunderers -- So that it would be a positve gain to the State -- for the Govmt to purchase them. --

Moreover, we find it infinitely easier to enlist and recruit men, for the Mounted Service than for infantry alone -- Indeed, a gentleman said he could enlist twenty to one -- for the mounted one infantry service --

If you can find it consistent with duty or law to allow Col Grider to enlist mounted men, we believe the Regiment can be raised very soon; otherwise it is doubtful whether it will be fully raised other than by the application of the draft -- This is a serious matter with us in
this Country -- exposed as the people are to these bands of depridaton & plunderers -- One good Reg of Mounted men -- raised in our Midst, who know the Country & dont have to Study maps or geography to learn it, will do us a vast amount of good -- and prevent a great amount of evil -- We earnestly invite yr attention to our request & hope it can be granted --

Very Respectfully
R Rodes --
Wm V. Loving
A. C. Dickinson
J. H. M Goodman
P,, Hines

Bowling Green
July 15/63
Rodes. R. and others.
Guerrilla depredations and recruiting in his section

The Govr. has no power to mount the Regt.
J W F
